security: Revealing that headquarters did not consider the attachments to be of special operational import could undermine the perceived value of JMWAVEâ€™s propaganda efforts in the eyes of UR contacts. Quoting directly: "Paragraph 3 of refs Concerned elements at headquarters stated the attachments with interest; however, the material was not considered of special operational import to merit specific guidance to witting contacts in the UR."
summary: A dispatch from the Chief of Special Affairs Staff to the Chief of Station, JMWAVE, regarding reactions from headquarters to UR propaganda efforts. Headquarters did not consider the material to be of special operational import but valued additional efforts to reach and influence PRO audiences.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET dispatch, dated June 18, 1963, from the Chief of the Special Affairs Staff to the Chief of Station at JMWAVE, conveys headquarters' reaction to UR propaganda efforts, referencing UNGA 9274. While headquarters reviewed the attached materials with interest, they did not deem them of significant operational value to warrant specific guidance to knowing contacts in the UR. The dispatch emphasizes that further efforts by the UR to reach and influence PRO audiences would be highly valued.
title: Reactions from WH to UR Propaganda and Desire to concentrate on Pors
